question:
Consider the following statements about Nitrogen Dioxide:
  1. It is a greenhouse gas as per Kyoto protocol
  2. It is a pollutant considered for measuring National Air Quality Index
  3. Nitrogen dioxide is a colourless and odourless gas
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: The pollutants considered for the measurement of Air Quality Index are (PM<sub>10</sub>, PM<sub>2.5</sub>, NO<sub>2</sub>, SO<sub>2</sub>, CO, O<sub>3</sub>, NH<sub>3</sub>, and Pb) for which short-term (up to 24-hourly averaging period) National Ambient Air Quality Standards are prescribed. Third statement is incorrect because nitrogen dioxide is a reddish-brown gas with a pungent and irritating odour. The Kyoto protocol covers six gases carbon-dioxide (CO2), methane (CH4), nitrous oxide (N2O), hydro fluorocarbons (HFCs), per fluorocarbons (PFCs), and sulphur hexafluoride (SF6).
